description.narrative:
Rädda Barnen (Save the Children Sweden) has applied to Sida for funding of 1 402 810 SEK to carry out the ECHO-project “Integrated child-focused protection, education and health services for Rohingya refugees and host communities in Teknaf and Ukhia Upazillas, Cox's Bazar, Bangladesh” during 2020.
The overall objective and expected results are:
The overall objective: “To contribute to improving the wellbeing of Rohingya refugee and vulnerable host-community children and their families”.
The specific objective: “To provide access to quality humanitarian assistance through integrated child protection, education and health services”.
Result 1: Children affected by the Rohingya Refugee crisis are protected from abuse, neglect, exploitation, and other forms of violence through child protection services and child-focus advocacy based on minimum standards for child protection.
Result 2: School-age vulnerable adolescent girls access to quality learning opportunities.
Result 3: Rohingya population and host community have equitable access to quality comprehensive and life-saving primary health care and mental health services with focus on reproductive, maternal, neonatal and child health care.
Rädda Barnen will collaborate with the local civil society organisation Jagorani Chakra Foundation (JCF). Rädda Barnen is lead applicant to Sida and has the overall responsibility for the coordination and implementation of the Project.
The contribution has the EU Commission reference number: ECHO/-XA/BUD/2019/91019. The contribution's total budget is 2 144 181 EUR, which corresponds to approximately 23 002 920 SEK. The requested support from Sida is 1 402 810 SEK, which corresponds to 6% of the total budget.

Rädda Barnen har ansökt om finansiering av egeninsats om 1 402 810 SEK för ECHO-projektet “Integrated child-focused protection, education and health services for Rohingya refugees and host communities in Teknaf and Ukhia Upazillas, Cox's Bazar, Bangladesh” under 2020.
Insatsen syftar till att:
1. “To contribute to improving the wellbeing of Rohingya refugee and vulnerable host-community children and their families”.
2. “To provide access to quality humanitarian assistance through integrated child protection, education and health services”
Rädda Barnen kommer att arbeta i samverkan med den lokala civilsamhällesorganisationen Jagorani Chakra Foundation (JCF). Rädda Barnen är huvudsökande organisation och har det övergripande ansvaret för projektets implementering och koordinering.
Den aktuella insatsen har EU-kommissionens referensnummer ECHO/-XA/BUD/2019/91019. Insatsen har en total budget på 2 144 181 EUR, vilket motsvarar cirka 23 002 920 SEK. Av detta har Rädda Barnen beviljats 1 950 000 EUR från EU-kommissionen och ansöker om 1 402 810 SEK (cirka 6%) från Sida.

Övergripande mål: To contribute to improving the wellbeing of Rohingya refugee and vulnerable host-community children and their families.
Specifikt mål: To provide access to quality humanitarian assistance through integrated child protection, education and health services
Resultat 1: Children affected by the Rohingya Refugee crisis are protected from abuse, neglect, exploitation, and other forms of violence through child protection services and child-focus advocacy based on minimum standards for child protection
Resultat 2: School-age vulnerable adolescent girls access to quality learning opportunities
Resultat 3: Rohingya population and host community have equitable access to quality comprehensive and life-saving primary health care and mental health services with focus on reproductive, maternal, neonatal and child health care.

tag.narrative: 4.1 - By 2030, ensure that all girls and boys complete free, equitable and quality primary and secondary education leading to relevant and effective learning outcomes.
4.1 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla flickor och pojkar fullbordar avgiftsfri och likvärdig grundskole- och gymnasieutbildning av god kvalitet som leder till relevanta och ändamålsenliga kunskaper.
5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.

description.narrative:
Exempel på uppnådda resultat:
"Save the Children has implemented this action together with one local partner (JCF) under the Education in Emergencies component. This approach was tested as part of the existing SC EiE program, and demonstrated strong results due to the contextual knowledge, local staffing and expertise of the local partner, and strong community acceptance to manage the daily operation of the home-based learning Centers (HBLs). SC has developed a strong relationship with the local partner and leveraged on the local expertise resulting in implementation of a quality program for beneficiaries.The partnership with JCF was not only for implementing the ECHO funded project, but also for building its institutional capacity and systems e.g. on Financial management, Human Resource Management, Program Monitoring, Data Collection and Documentation. JCF is now one of the national NGOs having a good footprint into the Rohingya camps and considering its good collaboration and delivery with SCI. Other agreements with JCF have been signed to implement a 3-year Peer Education project which was launched in December 2019. Recently, UNICEF has also signed two agreements with JCF to implement education activities for the Rohingya children".
"Save the Children has an important role in terms of coordination and implementation across the three sectors together with other actors. The education context in this response is extremely complex and the sector forum provides a valuable opportunity not only to coordinate operationally but also in building a united position on the importance of education in the response. SC has a solid reputation as a child protection actor and is an active member in the sector coordination led by UNHCR and UNICEF. SC is the lead on the Interagency Case Management Task Group and has led the process on a consistent SOPs for responding to unaccompanied and separated children. Furthermore, SC also actively participates in the health sector coordination mechanism, being one of the 2 NGOs sitting in the health Strategic Advisory Group as well as chairing the ASRH taskforce within the SRH sub sector working group".
"Child Protection is one of the three sectors in this intervention. Within Case management 529 child cases (273 girls, 256 boys and 8 children with disabilities) included SGBV survivors, children engaged in labor, married children and neglected children have been reached thanks to the services delivered by ten social caseworkers. Community based comittees and other community actors, including para social workers, have been engaged in managing child vulnerabilities in the camps, as they grew in confidence in identifying and referring children of concern. Within this action, areas of case management were identified in need of strethening in order to provide safe and quality services for child survivors of SGBV. The technical team and all case supervisors thus attended a 6-day training on SGBV core concepts and received a contextualized version of the international caring for child survivors-training. Strengthening of Community-based child protection mechanisms has been made through the establishment of 29 groups (3 CBCPC, 6 parents clubs, 20 adolescent clubs) with provision of skills and capacity trainings resulting in community group members being able to identify and safely refer children at risk to appropriate services and actors, working with other groups and stakeholders to create protective environments for children".
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
